thread.title: Steve Sarkisian reportedly set to be offensive coordinator for Atlanta Falcons
thread.title_full: Steve Sarkisian reportedly set to be offensive coordinator for Atlanta Falcons

author: Chuck Schilken
title: Steve Sarkisian reportedly set to be offensive coordinator for Atlanta Falcons
text:
Steve Sarkisian reportedly set to be offensive coordinator for Atlanta Falcons CFP National Championship Kevin C. Cox / Getty Images Steve Sarkisian calls plays for Alabama during the College Football Playoff national championship game against Clemson on Jan. 9. Steve Sarkisian calls plays for Alabama during the College Football Playoff national championship game against Clemson on Jan. 9. (Kevin C. Cox / Getty Images) Chuck Schilken is headed to the Atlanta Falcons .
The former USC coach is set to become the offensive coordinator for the defending NFC champions, according to multiple media reports. 
Sarkisian was recently hired as the offensive coordinator at Alabama, replacing another former Trojans coach, Lane Kiffin . After Kiffin left the Crimson Tide early to concentrate on his new job as head coach at Florida Atlantic, Sarkisian called Alabama’s offensive plays in the College Football Playoff national championship loss to Clemson. 
In Atlanta, Sarkisian will replace former offensive coordinator Kyle Shanahan, who is the new head coach of the San Francisco 49ers . Shanahan’s final game with the Falcons was Sunday night’s overtime loss to the New England Patriots in Super Bowl LI. Caption Dodgers FanFest: Take me out to the ball game

After a first half in which he played like that impostor in a Tom Brady mask, the New England Patriots quarterback put on a Super Bowl performance for the ages Sunday, leading his team back from a 25-point deficit to beat the Atlanta Falcons in overtime, 34-28.
